longDef.en: a device for measuring and showing time, usually found in or on a building and not worn by a person

examples.en: We have an antique clock on our mantelpiece.
examples.cn: 我们家的壁炉架上有一只老式钟表。

examples.en: The town-hall clock says (= shows that the time is) nine o'clock.
examples.cn: 市政厅的大钟指向了9点。

examples.en: I think the kitchen clock is fast/slow (= is showing a later/earlier time than it should).
examples.cn: 我觉得厨房的钟表快／慢了。

examples.en: The clock began to strike twelve.
She set her clock (= put it to the right time) by the time signal on the radio.
examples.cn: 她根据收音机上的报时信号对表。

longDef.en: to change the time on your clocks to an hour earlier, at an officially chosen time of year:
longDef.cn: 今晚别忘了把钟拨慢一小时。

examples.en: Don't forget to turn the clocks back tonight.
examples.cn: 今晚别忘了把钟拨慢一小时。

longDef.en: to change the time on your clocks to an hour later, at an officially chosen time of year:

examples.en: We turn the clocks forward today, so our children will be short of sleep.

longDef.en: a speedometer (= a device that measures speed)

examples.en: I was only doing 30 mph on the clock.
examples.cn: 速度表上显示我的车速只有每小时30英里。

longDef.en: a milometer (= a device for recording distance travelled)

examples.en: My car's only got 10,000 miles on the clock.
examples.cn: 根据里程表，我的车才跑了1万英里。

longDef.en: to take a particular time exactly to do or complete something

examples.en: He clocked ten seconds in the 100 metres (= he ran it in ten seconds).

longDef.en: to show or reach a particular speed or distance on a measuring device
longDef.cn: 显示，达到（某一速度或里程）

examples.en: The police clocked him doing 80 mph in a 50 mph area.
examples.cn: 警察测出他在限速每小时50英里的地区开到了时速80英里。

examples.en: Jim's car has clocked (up) (= travelled) 40,000 miles in less than two years.
examples.cn: 吉姆的车不到两年跑了4万英里。

longDef.en: to hit someone, especially on the head or face
longDef.cn: 打，揍，击（尤指头部或脸部）

examples.en: Then the other guy turned round and clocked him one (= hit him).
examples.cn: 这时，另一个家伙转过身来揍了他一顿。
